snippet: The doctors were charged with crimes related to the popular uprising last year, in a case widely seen as a test of the Bahraini monarchy’s commitment to political reform.
abstract: Appeals court in Bahrain upholds the convictions of nine doctors charged with crimes related to the popular uprising in 2011; sentences them to between one month and five years in prison; verdict is denounced by many as a political move designed to punish the defendants for their criticism of government actions and policies.
lead_paragraph: The doctors were charged with crimes related to the popular uprising last year, in a case widely seen as a test of the Bahraini monarchy’s commitment to political reform.

headline.seo: Bahrain Court Upholds Convictions of 9 Doctors
